text:
RED ALERT! Pretty massive theme update bug introduces which changes the name of the master theme folder.

<https://www.loom.com/share/884e627101c54cfd85a0f03ea393c191>
More reports of this coming in and screwing up live website be removing the theme style.  Here's another customer who updated. <https://www.law365.co/> (ID 7514936)
Here is the Support Ticket Number for the customer above: #8276019
Here is the Support Ticket Number for the first customer who I mentioned in th loom video. #8276247
<@UA5DFM7CK> Just updated one of our themes and it broke quite a few things. I would imagine this is the reason. Have you heard any updates on this?
<@U89DUQGKD> -  Thanks for the report.  I haven't heard anything back yet but I'm assuming the HS Team is on it as I can see they've watched my video above.
I would assume. I would imagine they have all hands around for the new launch. If you hear anything, please let us know

<@UA5DFM7CK> I am digging into our client that upgraded our theme. We did not run into the bug that you reported earlier. We do have a dash in our name, and somehow we avoided the issue that you reported.

We did run into css files just not getting pulled in and processed though. We released a new module and the module is all there, but not the css that makes that module pretty.

<https://www.loom.com/share/08e5e9ce3d94486aa4e484f14f7ba114>
I'm happy to hear that you're client avoided the issue a few of my customers are facing.  Super odd about the module not syncing with the CSS file though.
Different behaviors are always fun to track down :smile:

Hey Kevin, we have seen it. We have engineers working on resolving the issue. For awareness for others this issue doesn’t appear to be widespread. It is also not related to the new marketplace.

For future reference if you are running into issues that seem like a bug in the HubSpot platform, the best path forward is to contact support <http://help.HubSpot.com|help.HubSpot.com>.
<@U89DUQGKD> you said you were experiencing some sort of issue. Has support been contacted about that?

<@U7SL518D6> Yep! I opened a ticket with them on that portal and gave them the same information as that loom. I was just posting it here as well for others to see in case they were experiencing similar issues
I started a new thread below this one with that loom
<@U89DUQGKD> This does appear to be an unrelated issue. I’ve reviewed the ticket associated to this and I can see that support is actively working on this.
Great! This site is not live, so its not an urgent issue in that regards.

<@U7SL518D6> I'm happy the team is working on it and it's not widespread.  Awesome!

I'm finding it hard to understand how it's not related to the big marketplace release??  The timing is all to coincidental wouldn't you say?

Also, I always now direct people to contact support.  I'm just trying to help you all triage the more major things I'm hearing on the front lines as it relates to major feature roll outs.

> I’m finding it hard to understand how it’s not related to the big marketplace release?? The timing is all to coincidental wouldn’t you say?
The timing is unfortunately just that - It’s coincidental.

If you suspect you’re seeing a trend across multiple customer accounts then submitting a ticket through your provider account is a helpful way of signaling to our teams.
